original: EKSTRÖM, Vidar, Civilingenjör, Disponent, Fittja, f Sthlm 24/9 02 av fil dr A E o Signe Melin. Studex Saltsjöbaden 20, KTH 25. Konsulting h Messrs Crompton & Ekström London 28—31, eg konsult vksmh i Sthlm 31—33, ing v Ahlby säteri o ds ind i Fittja sed. 33, disp AB Fittja Familjetvätt sed. 39, styr.led där, styr.suppl Fittja el distr.frn, deläg Ahlby sät o ds ind. Led Sthlms l hush.sällsk. Resor-. Tyskl 27—28, Holl 28, Engl 2&—31. Av trycket: FI upps i sv o eng facktidskr i el-, elmek-o tvättekn frågor. Hobbies: Organisation, musik, jakt, fiske, segling. AB Fittja Familjetvätt är banbrytande f inf av ration tekn o mek metoder inom tvättind.
translated: EKSTRÖM, Vidar, Engineer, Chief Executive Officer, Fittja, born in Stockholm on September 24, 1902, to Dr. A E and Signe Melin. Graduated from Saltsjöbaden in 1920, and from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) in 1925. Consulted with Messrs Crompton & Ekström in London from 1928 to 1931, and then worked as a consultant for VKSMH in Stockholm from 1931 to 1933. Joined Ahlby Estate as an engineer and industrialist in Fittja in 1933, and became the CEO of AB Fittja Familjetvätt (Fittja Family Laundry) in 1939, where he also served on the board of directors. Additionally, he was a board supervisor for Fittja's electric distribution district, and a co-owner of Ahlby Estate. He was a member of the Stockholm household society and a frequent traveler. He visited Germany from 1927 to 1928, the Netherlands in 1928, and England from 1929 to 1931. Published articles in Swedish and English specialized journals on electricity, electrical engineering, and laundry technology. Hobbies included organization, music, hunting, fishing, and sailing. AB Fittja Familjetvätt was groundbreaking in implementing efficient technical and mechanical methods in the laundry industry.

structured.name: Vidar Ekström

publication.name: FI upps i sv o eng facktidskr i el-, elmek-o tvättekn frågor

structured.description: Vidar Ekström, born in Stockholm on September 24, 1902, was a Swedish engineer and Chief Executive Officer. He graduated from Saltsjöbaden in 1920 and the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) in 1925. He worked as a consultant with Messrs Crompton & Ekström in London from 1928 to 1931, and then as a consultant for VKSMH in Stockholm from 1931 to 1933. In 1933, he joined Ahlby Estate as an engineer and industrialist in Fittja. From 1939, he served as the Chief Executive Officer of AB Fittja Familjetvätt, a groundbreaking laundry company implementing efficient technical and mechanical methods. He was a board member of various organizations and had a passion for organization, music, hunting, fishing, and sailing. He traveled to Germany from 1927 to 1928, the Netherlands in 1928, and England from 1929 to 1931. Vidar Ekström also published articles on electricity, electrical engineering, and laundry technology.
